info.title: TON HTTP API
info.description:
This API enables HTTP access to TON blockchain - getting accounts and wallets information, looking up blocks and transactions, sending messages to the blockchain, calling get methods of smart contracts, and more.

In addition to REST API, all methods are available through [JSON-RPC endpoint](#json%20rpc)  with `method` equal to method name and `params` passed as a dictionary.

The response contains a JSON object, which always has a boolean field `ok` and either `error` or `result`. If `ok` equals true, the request was successful and the result of the query can be found in the `result` field. In case of an unsuccessful request, `ok` equals false and the error is explained in the `error`.

API Key should be sent either as `api_key` query parameter or `X-API-Key` header.

get.description: Get basic information about the address: balance, code, data, last_transaction_id.

parameters.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

schema.title: Address
schema.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

parameters.name: address

get.description: Similar to previous one but tries to parse additional information for known contract types. This method is based on tonlib's function *getAccountState*. For detecting wallets we recommend to use *getWalletInformation*.

parameters.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

schema.title: Address
schema.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

parameters.name: address

get.description: Retrieve wallet information. This method parses contract state and currently supports more wallet types than getExtendedAddressInformation: simple wallet, standart wallet, v3 wallet, v4 wallet.

parameters.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

schema.title: Address
schema.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

parameters.name: address

get.description: Get transaction history of a given address.

parameters.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

schema.title: Address
schema.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions in response.

schema.title: Limit
schema.description: Maximum number of transactions in response.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Logical time of transaction to start with, must be sent with *hash*.

schema.title: Lt
schema.description: Logical time of transaction to start with, must be sent with *hash*.

parameters.name: lt

parameters.description: Hash of transaction to start with, in *base64* or *hex* encoding , must be sent with *lt*.

schema.title: Hash
schema.description: Hash of transaction to start with, in *base64* or *hex* encoding , must be sent with *lt*.

parameters.name: hash

parameters.description: Logical time of transaction to finish with (to get tx from *lt* to *to_lt*).

schema.title: To Lt
schema.description: Logical time of transaction to finish with (to get tx from *lt* to *to_lt*).

parameters.name: to_lt

parameters.description: By default getTransaction request is processed by any available liteserver. If *archival=true* only liteservers with full history are used.

schema.title: Archival
schema.description: By default getTransaction request is processed by any available liteserver. If *archival=true* only liteservers with full history are used.

parameters.name: archival

get.description: Get consensus block and its update timestamp.
Look up block by either *seqno*, *lt* or *unixtime*.

get.description: Get transactions of the given block.
Get metadata of a given block.
Locate outcoming transaction of *destination* address by incoming message.
Same as previous. Locate outcoming transaction of *destination* address by incoming message
Locate incoming transaction of *source* address by outcoming message.

parameters.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

schema.title: Address
schema.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form.

post.description: Send serialized boc file: fully packed and serialized external message to blockchain.
Send query - unpacked external message. This method takes address, body and init-params (if any), packs it to external message and sends to network. All params should be boc-serialized.
Estimate fees required for query processing. *body*, *init-code* and *init-data* accepted in serialized format (b64-encoded).
Run get method on smart contract.
All methods in the API are available through JSON-RPC protocol ([spec](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification)).

ignore_chksig.title: Ignore Chksig
ignore_chksig.description: If true during test query processing assume that all chksig operations return True

stack.title: Stack
stack.description: Array of stack elements: `[['num',3], ['cell', cell_object], ['slice', slice_object]]`

body.title: Body
body.description: b64-encoded boc-serialized cell with message body
